result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Bonilla Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,293.77 payable to the victim Marilyn R.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currenly serving.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program  if deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Bonilla Jr

Decision and Order Denying Motion for Nunc Pro Tunc Inquiry, signed and filed.
Copy mailed to defendant.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jean Kies, Br. 45, for review. cmc

Defendant's Motion Seeking Nunc Pro Tunc Inquiry to Verify Filing of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  (Ricardo Bonilla Jr - #438373, Oakhill Correctional Institution, PO Box 938, Oregon WI 53575).

Per remittitur dated November 1, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP001802 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on September 18,  2017, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Paul G. Bonneson is relieved of further representation of Ricardo Bonilla, Jr. in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.
Credit for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $2,293.77 payable to the victim, Marilyn R.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

 Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Restitution Worksheet with attachments.

Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Ricardo Bonilla not in court, in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Ricardo Bonilla not in court, in custody.   Ann Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 06-24-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Ricardo Bonilla not in court, in custody.  
Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense request for short adjournment granted.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in custody.  Chad Wozniak for Ann Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Marilyn R.; Alice DR.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Ricardo Bonilla in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner Orders the Sheriff Department to collect DNA from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
